Reviews.Content: Above par Stayed in room 108 for 5 nights during a cool/windy week in November 08. Pluses: Superb view across harbour to city skylineSmall balcony was ideal for drinks and watching the sunset over the cityNice location in peaceful village atmosphere and close to beach$180 pn for accommodation this good is a bargainVery comfortable, large (King) bedSpacious roomAway from the hustle and bustle of the cityAdjacent to park - good for kidsRight on the ferry route - good for getting into the city sans trafficMinuses: Old fashioned box TV and no CD playerEvery morning at 6am a man with a high-powered hose spend an hour washing the beer garden just below our room - too noisy, too earlyNice breakfast - buffet - but the same every single morning, a little monotonousHardly anywhere to hang your towel in the bathroomThe accommodation was listed as luxury on their website - they really should put some quality magazines, a CD player and a few other luxury items in the room to qualify for luxury statusStaff mostly impersonable
Reviews.Author: turns71

Reviews.Content: great place My room at this hotel was reasonably priced and had a beautiful view all the way to Sydney across the harbor. The ferry stop is no more than 30 meters from the hotel exit, there is a nice park next to the hotel, the fish-n-chip place behind the hotel is very good and reasonably priced, and the staff is friendly. Bondi Beach is 5 minutes drive and there is a beautiful trail right out the door of the hotel that goes along the cliffs above the water that's great for jogging and for site seeing. The parking can be a bit of a problem when the weather is nice because of everyone parking for the ferry, and the fruit bats in the trees at night took a bit of time for a midwestern boy to get used to - but I guess they don't bother anyone. There's a good Asian restaurant close by, but the Doyle's place next door is a bit over priced. Nice hotel - I'd go there again.
Reviews.Author: TravelMavin

Reviews.Content: Just Perfect Just recently I stayed at this hotel. I was a bit apprehensive at first, but I was pleasantly surprised.I booked a harbour front room and was assigned room 111, which is the best room. So spacious, asthetically pleasing and definitely at a 5 star level.I originally was assigned room 110, but was upgraded for free to 111. Room 111 is the most spectacular room. Huge balcony, bathroom, comfortable king size bed and a room fit for a king. I seriously recommend you book room 111.The hotel is just fabulous! Great pleasant service, quiet. The hotel even surpasses the quality of other hotels I have stayed at such as The Amora Jamison, The Sheraton. The view is breathtaking!In my opinion this hotel should be rated 5 star and not 4. The 4 star rating is selling themselves short.My only disappointment was the buffet breakfast. I was told by the last min website that it was hot buffet breakfast, however it was 98% continental. But in saying this, the buffet breakfast was just delicious.
Reviews.Author: miaow_girl

Reviews.Content: Stay here once in your life I randomly turned up here whilst driving round Sydney. I believe this was once called Doyles Palace Hotel. The rooms are spacious and have exceptionally well appointed bathrooms. The Hotel has a huge dining and drinking terrace with stunning views towards the Sydney Skyline. ( I think this is quite famous). Next door is the original Doyles seafood restaurant. Don't expect huge amounts of service here. Its a bit like a huge pub/restaurant with rooms. Staff couldn't figure out the wireless internet and the rooms lack anything other than floor level electric sockets. But really these are tiny complaints, this is a thoroughly lovely place to stay for a short while. Once in your life, have fish and chips with a crisp white wine overlooking the skyline and bay. Incredible.
Reviews.Author: AndrewCrown
